task.title: Creating path reports
task.shortdesc: Create a path report request to specify the criteria for the customer paths that you want to analyze.

taskbody.prereq: For information about the report criteria you must specify to create a path report, see .

step.cmd: Click the link in the title bar to open the Path Analysis page.
Select a segment from the Segment list, or accept the default value of All customers.
Select a path ranking option from the Report options list.
Click Start or End touch point on the Path Analysis page to define a start or end touch point for the path.
Select an event to associate with the touch point.
To view details about the event, including event attributes, provider, and publisher, open the Details box.
Open the Event Options box and specify the date range that you want to report on for this event.
Add one or more filter conditions to the event.

substep.cmd: Select an event attribute and operator from the lists.
Enter a value to filter on.
If you want to add another filter criteria, click Add another criterion.
Select the filtering logic that you want to use from the list at the top of the window:

ul.li: Satisfy all below applies AND logic to the filter processing. Events must meet all of the listed filter conditions to be included in the results.
Satisfy any below applies OR logic to the filter processing. Events that meet any of the listed filter conditions are included in the results.

substep.cmd: When you are finished adding filters, click Done.

step.cmd: To define another touch point, repeat steps 4 - 9 for the undefined touch point.
Click the look-back or look-forward link on the path diagram to specify the number of days in the range, or accept the default range of 14 days.

p.note: If your path includes both a start point and an end point, you do not need to specify a look-back or look-forward range. The results for paths that have both touch points defined include all interactions that occurred between the two touch points.

substep.cmd: Enter the number of days to look back or forward in the box.

stepresult.p: You can access completed reports from the Report status menu.
If your report returned no data, you can modify the event options and rerun the report.
